DataElement.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Version Condition Coding System ISO21090.Uid.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An action plan of a pre-clinical or clinical study in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. Study subjects may receive diagnostic, therapeutic or other types of interventions. The assignment of the intervention may or may not be random. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed. The coding system used for recording conditions that are the focus of a study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Version Condition Coding System
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A state of being, such as a state of health.:The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis.:A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.

The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: A state of being, such as a state of health.:The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis.:A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

Concepts.definition: A state of being, such as a state of health.
The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis.
A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A string that is an identifier, and therefore must be either a string representation of an OID, a UUID, or a simple token taken from a lsit of controlled names for the context in which the Uid is used.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
